video.name: Holiday Season Special: Delicious Furikake Chex Mix!
video.description:
Make this Hawaiian favorite‚ÄîFurikake Chex Mix‚Äîfor a holiday gift exchange, movie/game night, or potluck. It‚Äôs such a fun, irresistible treat that will keep everyone snacking!

CHAPTERS

Let's cook EASY + AUTHENTIC Japanese recipes at home!
Konnichiwa! I'm Nami, the creator of the Just One Cookbook website and cooking blog. I am glad that you are here with me. Here and on JustOneCookbook.com, you can find over 1,200 recipes, cooking tips, step-by-step instructions, ingredients, and shopping guides focused on Japanese cuisine.

I'm a native Japanese, born and raised in Yokohama, Japan, and now live in San Francisco, California, with my husband Mr. JOC, two high school kids, and a dog named Miso. I also wrote three Japanese cookbooks, where I share popular recipes like Oyakodon, Tamagoyaki, Chawanmushi, Sushi, Okonomiyaki, Mochi Ice Cream, Gyoza, Ramen, and more!

recipeYield: 8 (or 5 32-oz mason jars or 4 treat bags (6" x 11") filled up to the top)
recipeIngredient: 1 bag Japanese roasted green pea snack

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 250¬∫F (120¬∫C). Gather all the ingredients. This recipe is very flexible and forgiving. Use approximately the same amount of party mix of your choice.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 250¬∫F (120¬∫C). Gather all the ingredients. This recipe is very flexible and forgiving. Use approximately the same amount of party mix of your choice.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium saucepan, melt ¬Ω cup unsalted butter over medium heat. Once melted, add ¬Ω cup brown rice syrup, ¬Ω cup sugar, ¬º cup neutral oil, and 2 Tbsp soy sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium saucepan, melt ¬Ω cup unsalted butter over medium heat. Once melted, add ¬Ω cup brown rice syrup, ¬Ω cup sugar, ¬º cup neutral oil, and 2 Tbsp soy sauce.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir to mix until the sugar is completely dissolved. Lower the heat to avoid boiling. Remove from heat to cool slightly while you prepare the party mix blend.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir to mix until the sugar is completely dissolved. Lower the heat to avoid boiling. Remove from heat to cool slightly while you prepare the party mix blend.

recipeInstructions.text: To a large baking pan, add 4 cups Corn Chex, 4 cups Wheat Chex, 4 cups Honeycomb cereal, 4 cups Bugles, 2 cups pretzels, and 1 bag Japanese roasted green pea snack.
recipeInstructions.name: To a large baking pan, add 4 cups Corn Chex, 4 cups Wheat Chex, 4 cups Honeycomb cereal, 4 cups Bugles, 2 cups pretzels, and 1 bag Japanese roasted green pea snack.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk the syrup one more time to make sure it‚Äòs not separated. Then, evenly distribute the syrup over the party mix. Using two silicone spatulas, toss the party mix well until evenly coated.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk the syrup one more time to make sure it‚Äòs not separated. Then, evenly distribute the syrup over the party mix. Using two silicone spatulas, toss the party mix well until evenly coated.

recipeInstructions.text: Evenly distribute 1 jar Nori Komi Furikake over the party mix. Toss well until evenly coated. If you like it spicy, sprinkle with 2 tsp shichimi togarashi (Japanese seven spice), to your liking.
recipeInstructions.name: Evenly distribute 1 jar Nori Komi Furikake over the party mix. Toss well until evenly coated. If you like it spicy, sprinkle with 2 tsp shichimi togarashi (Japanese seven spice), to your liking.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 250¬∫F (120¬∫C) for 1 hour. Take the pan out every 15 minutes (3 times total) to toss it all together.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 250¬∫F (120¬∫C) for 1 hour. Take the pan out every 15 minutes (3 times total) to toss it all together.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the oven and let it cool completely. Toss the party mix every 15 minutes (at least 3 times) to loosen it up as it cools. If you skip this step, the party mix will stick to each other while it cools. If that happens, put the pan back in the oven and bake for 15 minutes. The syrup will melt again and become loose. Make sure to toss the party mix every 15 minutes this time!
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the oven and let it cool completely. Toss the party mix every 15 minutes (at least 3 times) to loosen it up as it cools. If you skip this step, the party mix will stick to each other while it cools. If that happens, put the pan back in the oven and bake for 15 minutes. The syrup will melt again and become loose. Make sure to toss the party mix every 15 minutes this time!

recipeInstructions.text: Serve and enjoy! If you don‚Äòt eat it right away, divide the party mix into airtight bags/containers.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve and enjoy! If you don‚Äòt eat it right away, divide the party mix into airtight bags/containers.

itemListElement.text: You can keep in an airtight container or mason jars and store it in a dark, cool place for up to 2‚Äì3 weeks or in the freezer for 2‚Äì3 months.
itemListElement.name: You can keep in an airtight container or mason jars and store it in a dark, cool place for up to 2‚Äì3 weeks or in the freezer for 2‚Äì3 months.

review.reviewBody: Sooo good! Had everything but the shichimi togarashi... on a hunch, I tried a bit of chili oil (just a tsp, but could have done more I think) and it gave it a nice little kick without overpowering. Was thinking the little chili arare would also be a good addition. Will let you know if I try it ‚ô•Ô∏è
I tried it with vegan butter and neutral oil (avocado oil) and it came out really good!!
Delicious recipe!! The only thing I might try next time would be possibly adding the wasabi peas at the end? I feel like they totally lost their kick after the syrup and cooking process!

This is delicious and easy! It‚Äôs a nice twist on traditional Chex mix. The hardest part was finding all the ingredients. For some reason my grocery stores were sold out of Bugles and Japanese roasted peas. I couldn‚Äôt find brown rice syrup so I used corn syrup and it still was good. Two batches later and I‚Äôm still thinking about fun add-ins. Thank you for sharing!

I've made this twice this week, given a good chunk to friends and all of them have said this is the best chex mix they've ever had. The only change I made was using corn syrup instead of brown rice syrup due to cost (could only find $15 jars). This is super tasty and will definitely become a holiday staple now.

This is the first time I have ever made Chex Mix. I would usually buy the store bought mixes but they're usually way too salty for me. The Furikake Chex Mix on the other hand is amazing! It's sweet, well balanced and slight zing from the wasabi peas. This is my absolute favorite Chex Mix. I'm also giving out some jars of it as gifts too. That way I can share this amazing snack mix and recipe.

This is so yummy! I doubled the recipe and added a cup of extra bugles and another cup of honey comb cereal. I took half the mixture and added sichimi toragashi to one half of the mixture for the adults. Then filled 12-32oz mason jars to give as Christmas gifts to my neighbors. I can‚Äôt wait for them to try it!
